thread.title: Imbetiba Seaport

title: Imbetiba Seaport
text:
Only registered TrekEarth members may write critiques. Photographer's Note 
The Imbetiba Seaport is owned by "Petr√≥leo Brasileiro S.A. - Petrobras" was built in 1979. It aims to support exploration operations and extraction of oil of Campos basin and don't have any commercial activity. The Seaport has an area of 55,000 square meters, where is distributed 3 piers each one with 15x90 meters size and each have have 2 berths. The maximum draft is 8 meter so limiting the size of the ships. In terms of supply, the Port of Imbetiba has storage capacity of 4600 cubic meters of diesel and 6000 cubic meters of water and has an average monthly turnover of about 30 thousand tons of cargo for shipment, and another 20 tons to landing. In terms of supply, the Port of Imbetiba has storage capacity of 4600 cubic meters of diesel and 6000 cubic meters of water and has an average monthly turnover of about 30 thousand tons of cargo for shipment, and another 20 tons to landing. The average number of moorings is 450 to 500 ships per month. It has about 2500 employees. In 2012 it became the 3rd largest port in the country, in values exported of US $ 6.8 million.
